field.label: Enabled
field.help: This will enable or disable the instance.

field.label: Name
field.help: Set the name for this instance.

field.label: Instance
field.help: This is the instance number to give the WireGuard device a unique name (wgX).

field.label: Public key
field.help: Public key of this instance. You can specify your own one, or a key will be generated after saving.

field.label: Private key
field.help: Private key of this instance. You can specify your own one, or a key will be generated after saving. Please keep this key safe.

field.label: Listen port
field.help: Optionally set a fixed port for this instance to listen on. The standard port range starts at 51820.

field.label: MTU
field.help: Set a specific device MTU for this instance.

field.label: DNS servers
field.help: Set specific DNS servers for this instance. Use with care.

field.label: Tunnel address
field.help: List of addresses to configure on the device. Please use CIDR notation like 10.0.0.1/24.

field.label: Depend on (CARP)
field.help: The CARP VHID to depend on. When this virtual address is not in master state, then the instance will be shutdown.

field.label: Peers
field.help: List of peers for this instance.

field.label: Disable routes
field.help: This will prevent installing routes. Usually you only enable this to do own routing decisions via a local gateway and gateway rules.

field.label: Gateway
field.help: Set the gateway IP here when using "Disable routes" feature. You also have to add this as a system gateway.
